meanings.sent1: Eating just one slice of cake may sufficer for me.
meanings.sent2: A quick nap should sufficer to recharge my energy.
meanings.sent3: I thought one cookie would sufficer, but I ended up eating the whole jar!
meanings.sent4: Her smile sufficers to brighten even the gloomiest days.
meanings.sent5: The small boat may sufficer for calm waters, but not for a storm.

meanings.definition: To meet the needs or requirements
meanings.sent1: A glass of water will sufficer to quench your thirst.
meanings.sent2: Studying a bit every day will sufficer to pass the exam.
meanings.sent3: I tried to sufficer my hunger with a single apple, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: His determination sufficers to overcome any obstacle in his way.
meanings.sent5: A band-aid may sufficer for a small cut, but not for a deep wound.

meanings.definition: To satisfy or fulfill a purpose
meanings.sent1: A simple apology may sufficer to mend the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent2: Adding a pinch of salt will sufficer to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: I thought a quick fix would sufficer, but the problem persisted.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter sufficers to bring joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: A single key may sufficer to unlock many doors in life.
